question:
Which of the following are effects of eutrophication on biodiversity?
1. Algal blooms restrict the sunlight to penetrate & affects the photosynthesizing plants.
2. It causes death of plants.
3. Bacteria consumes all the oxygen on decomposition & results in lack of oxygen which eventually leads to death of all living organism in aquatic ecosystem.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Eutrophication results in algal bloomsÂ  which restrict the sunlight to penetrate & affects the photosynthesizing plants. It causes death of plants. Bacteria consumes all the oxygen on decomposition & results in lack of oxygen which eventually leads to death of all living organism in aquatic ecosystem.
